SEARCH
Package com.lboric.soccerdnd.controllers

Class PlayerStatsController

java.lang.Object
com.lboric.soccerdnd.controllers.PlayerStatsController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/player-stats") public class PlayerStatsController extends Object
REST controller for managing player statistics.

This controller provides endpoints for CRUD operations on player statistics, including retrieval, addition, updating, and deletion.

Base URL: /api/player-stats

  • Method Details

    • getPlayersStats

      @GetMapping org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<SortedSet<PlayerStatsDTO>> getPlayersStats()
      Retrieves the statistics for all players, sorted by player ID and season year.
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing a sorted set of PlayerStatsDTO

    • getPlayerStatsByPlayerId

      @GetMapping("/{id}") org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<PlayerStatsDTO> getPlayerStatsByPlayerId(@PathVariable Long id)
      Retrieves the statistics for a specific player by their ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the player whose statistics are to be retrieved
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the PlayerStatsDTO of the specified player

    • addPlayerStats

      @PostMapping("/add") org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<PlayerStatsDTO> addPlayerStats(@NonNull @Valid @RequestBody @NonNull @Valid PlayerStatsDTO playerStatsDTO)
      Adds new statistics for a player.
      Parameters:
      playerStatsDTO - the PlayerStatsDTO representing the player's statistics to be added
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the created PlayerStatsDTO

    • updatePlayerStats

      @PutMapping("/update") org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<PlayerStatsDTO> updatePlayerStats(@NonNull @Valid @RequestBody @NonNull @Valid PlayerStatsDTO playerStatsDTO)
      Updates existing statistics for a player.
      Parameters:
      playerStatsDTO - the PlayerStatsDTO containing the updated player statistics
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the updated PlayerStatsDTO

    • deletePlayer

      @DeleteMapping("/delete") org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> deletePlayer(@NonNull @Valid @RequestBody @NonNull @Valid PlayerStatsDTO playerStatsDTO)
      Deletes statistics for a specific player based on their name, surname, and season year.
      Parameters:
      playerStatsDTO - the PlayerStatsDTO identifying the player's statistics to be deleted
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with no content upon successful deletion
